title: [Medicine] Some people develop antibodies against PEG, a common polymer found in cosmetics and biopharmaceuticals including some mRNA vaccines. These antibodies can impact the effectiveness of drugs that are capsulated with PEG, a new study shows, and may require screening programs to be introduced.

[Medicine] Johns Hopkins study supports potential for injectable ‘chemical vaccine’ for malaria using atovaquone - Researchers demonstrate in mouse model that key mutation that renders malaria parasites resistant to atovaquone also makes them non-transmissible via mosquitoes
